column1: He sang of long summer days and the music of waters beating upon the shore. He sang of the moonlight and the starlight. All the wonders of the night
column2: all the beauty of the morning
column4: said the Great Spirit here are some beautiful things for you to bear away with
column5: you to your summer home. You will love them
column6: and all the little children will love them." At these words of the Great Spirit
column7: all the stones before him stirred with life and lifted themselves on many-colored wings. They fluttered away in the sunshine
column8: and the southwind sang to them as they went.So it was that the first butterflies came from a beautiful thought of the Great Spirit
column9: and in their wings were all the colors of the shining stones that he did not wish to hide away.
